Description:
Job Summary:A Lead AM Engineer is a highly skilled professional responsible for leading and managing additive manufacturing processes within an organization. This role involves overseeing the design, development, and production of parts or products using additive manufacturing technologies, such as 3D printing. The Lead AM Engineer plays a crucial role in advancing innovation and efficiency in manufacturing processes.Key Responsibilities:Process Development:
Lead the development and optimization of additive manufacturing processes and workflows.
Identify and implement best practices for additive manufacturing techniques.
Project Management:
Manage additive manufacturing projects from concept to completion, including resource allocation and scheduling.
Coordinate with cross-functional teams, including design, materials, and quality assurance.
Materials Selection:
Evaluate and select appropriate materials for specific additive manufacturing applications.
Conduct material testing and analysis to ensure suitability.
Technology Integration:
Stay updated with the latest additive manufacturing technologies and trends.
Identify opportunities to integrate new technologies into existing processes.Skills
Skills:
Bachelor's or master's degree in mechanical engineering, materials science, or a related field.
Extensive experience in additive manufacturing processes and technologies.
Strong knowledge of various 3D printing methods and materials.
Proficiency in CAD software and design for additive manufacturing (DFAM).
Project management skills, including budgeting and resource allocation.
Quality control and testing expertise in additive manufacturing.
Strong problem-solving and analytical skills.
Excellent communication and leadership abilities.
Safety-conscious and detail-oriented.
Innovation-driven with a focus on continuous improvement.
